item.title: Mikaela add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "I seem fated to pass through the world without colliding with it or moving it — and I'm sure I can't tell you whether the fate's good or evil. I don't die — I don't fall in love. And if other people die or fall in love they always do it when I'm just not there." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: Mikaela add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I might repeat to myself, slowly and soothingly, a list of quotations beautiful from minds profound; if I can remember any of the damn things." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mikaela add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mikaela add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mikaela add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Just erotic. Nothing kinky. It's the difference between using a feather and using a chicken." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mikaela add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mikaela add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mikaela add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Over the centuries, mankind has tried many ways of combating the forces of evil... prayer, fasting, good works and so on. Up until Doom, no one seemed to have thought about the double-barrel shotgun. Eat leaden death, demon..." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mikaela add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mikaela add a quote by Terry Pratchett
